reviewText:
National Zombie Park promises a realistic survival roguelike experience in a world infested by zombies: you're thrown into a forested area with some loot nearby and asked to survive as long as possible with both zombies and the progressive infection (yes, you start infected) trying to kill you.
What follows is a laggy, uninspired and ultimately quite dull romp in a barebones area while being chased by huge hordes of zombies that'll kill you in one hit.

PROS:

-none

CONS:

-unremarkable graphics still manage to create several framerate drops, how this can happen considering the top down perspective and how little is on screen is beyond me

-few sounds and they're all very weak: weapons sound tinny and zombie noises are pretty bad: there's also no music at all, not even on the main menu

-horrible animations, zombies just flail their arms awkwardly, reloads and melee bashes look very artificial

-awkward movement, you're not much faster than a zombie and can't sprint at all thus making escapes impossible

-no story whatsover, no goals, no leaderboards, nothing

-game world feels barren, just a few repeated tree models, some houses, fences, rare bunkers and that's all

-unfair loot spawn could leave you overflowing with batteries for your flashlight but with no antidote whatsoever thus forcing you to die and restart

-one hit kills coupled with bad framerate makes surviving a question of luck

-no way to edit keybinds unless you want to mess with the game files

-game only explains the controls, heck it doesn't even tell you that you're infected or how infection works

-you won't be surprised to know multiplayer is dead

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=528735526

National Zombie Park is functional, apart from the crippling framerate, but the fact it works will just let you experience a game that quickly becomes boring due to the very basic gameplay. Why would you be playing this and starting over and over? There's no story to uncover, no random objectives to complete, no high scores to compare...you just aimlessly wander the mostly empty area hoping to find some ammo and antidote while also praying that the game's framerate won't betray you when a zombie is near.

It's not only boring, it's pointless, and these- in my book-are two cardinal sins in a game: add to this the technical problems and the low production values and you'll see how this game is one I can't recommend at all. Even the devs probably realized this was a total mess since they abandoned it a few days after release.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you were one of the zombies, you might have more fun with this, as you would no longer need to see, and would be happy standing around doing nothing until you hear/sense potential brains nearby.

The game feels like a very early version. Hit detection is weird, you die instantly if the zombies get close, and the only interesting part of the map to explore are unground bunkers, but you can't see anything, and there doesn't appear to be any items to give provide light in the darkness.

If this was a free flash game on Kongregate, I'd say skip it... but since it actually costs money... run away!

reviewText: God... Oh... Dear, God, no... I have to say, from the pictures on Steam, the game didn't look half bad. Believe me. It is. If you're a person who's really into zombie games, and you like hardcore realistic zombie simulators then DO NOT GET THIS GAME. For the first thing, the game runs REALLY SLOW. I have an old Windows 7 desktop computer, and I know it doesn't have much ram, but this game looked like it would run fairly quickly. I mean, there's not really anything going on in it. It seems to have okay graphics, but not like super detailed. Well, those graphics on the screen are the highest quality they get in the game. Literally, it ran like 2 frames per second. I tried bumping down the graphics, until I got to the worst possible graphics, and got about 40 fps. These graphics, are, to say the least, look about equivalent to mid nineties graphics, and not even a high quality game from the nineties; like a crappy, low quality one. Now, it was the lowest quality, so I'm not picky about that, but DEAR GOD. It STILL ran pretty slow. Not to mention that the gameplay is... Um... Terrible? There's literally nothing to do but kill zombies, and the whole setup is actually pretty terribly designed. I actually think, LITERALLY, they probably spent more time on the title screen than the ACTUAL GAME. I was extremely dissatisfied with the game. I got it 90% off, and I regret buying it, and anyone who paid full price, should honestly get their lawyers on this. I laughed when I played the atrocity for the first time. It got old. This game ACTUALLY MAY BE... THE WORST GAME... EVER... It's really bad. EVEN IF THIS GAME IS 100% OFF, DO NOT BUY IT. IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR TIME DOWNLOADING. DOWNLOAD SOME OTHER ♥♥♥♥. A MINECRAFT MAP, I DON'T GIVE A ♥♥♥♥. DO NOT GET THIS.

reviewText:
So I have breifly played 'National Zombie Park' just out of curiosity for it being a new indie rogue like zombie game. For the game being at it's stage at develpoment I'd have to say it is pretty empty. The game is mostly filled with vegetation with the occasional building here and there. Combat reminds me of 'Hotline Miami' due every enemy can instantly kill you and you can kill almost every zombie first strike on the first day. I have been fortunate to make it a few days into the game and the difficulty was noticably increasing with higher density of zombies and more types. Also found an underground area which was cool and difficult but made the loot inside that much sweeter when found.

Pros:
- Cool Combat
- Collected loot feels earned
- Keeps you on edge
- Supplies run fast requiring you to keep a look out for more

Cons:
- Relitivly Empty
- Doesn't introduce you to the controls very well
- Random frame rate drops
- Confusing health system for a one hit kill game

All in all i would say to give this game a whirl, it is early development so bugs and such were expected when I bought it but i can see this game has alot that could be added to it so there is so much potential in it. I'm going to keep up with this game in hopes it improves and the experience gets better, just gotta hope the developers don't abandon it this early.  Would recommened to people that would like to be involved in a game that will hopefully undertake a great modification :)

reviewText: Loving all things zombie apocolypse, sandox oriented, and especially ragdoll physic based games NZP has me coming back for some overhead zed slaying everytime. NZP is very pretty its fun and its running off the unreal engine so gameplay is super smooth and very pleasing. Like any basic zombie survival esque sandbox game though you really just wish there was just a little bit more you could get yourself into, I mean.... please don't get me wrong I bought the game knowing exactly what I was buying and I am in love with it for that sole reason, but.... after putting a little time in I realize the huge potential the game has. Hopefully the devs are thinking of making a more dynamic world of surviving and continue to push out some really cool  updates to keep us coming back. I cant wait to see what National Zombie Park has to offer in the future hope to see you out there one day folks! Cheers! HAPPY HUNTING=\=====>(-_-)<

reviewText: I really like the aesthetics of the game and felt comfortable playing with the typical mouse controls. I would really like to have developers create the game with bette graphics although the current graphics are not bad. The gameplay is ok in terms of the genre but it does get repetitive at times. I have played other fps, rpg etc. games and this game seems to cover the elements. I would give it a thumbs up but still i would be biased if i didn't say anything negative as a lot of gamers have given more negative reviews than positive. I just think that developers need to polish it a little more and add to it. Overall it is an okay game.
